results.title: Flyaway
results.brief_description: Contrasts the earthbound obstacle ridden path of a man with the free-flowing glide of a plane. A spectrum of animals is used to represent the earthbound, the semi-bound and the free. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Fly about the house
results.brief_description: Two flies hatch out and go off in search of food. They first visit a well-kept home; the dustbin is properly covered, the householders wash their hands frequently, the larder door is kept closed and the food in it is well-covered. Baulked here, they go on to a slovenly household, find lots of food lying about, sample it all. One fly goes back to the first house, is sprayed and killed. The other goes on to another dirty house and spreads disease and death An animated film.

results.title: Flux
results.brief_description: Director Michaela French uses 2-D animation, over-laying images and sound to create a narrative. A woman narrates over abstracted imagery relating her feelings of loss and grief, coming to terms with the death of a soul-mate in a recent car accident. What emerges is an exploration into grief itself. The narrator not only looks at her separation from her soul-mate, but asks questions about the change of her physical space as a result of their absence.

results.title: Flux
results.brief_description:
A film about trust, about an accident, about falling out of love and about emerging from grief. Flux was created entirely on a desktop Macintosh using Adobe AfterEffects and Adobe Photoshop. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder. It is listed by Lynden Barber (film critic for The Australian newspaper) as one of “12 Film Breakthoughs” for its achievement as the first Australian film post-produced entirely on a home computer.
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may disturb some viewers

results.title: Flutter and its prevention
results.brief_description: The significance of “flutter” in aerodynamics and its drastic results, ie aeroplane crash. Ways to prevent flutter and therefore avoid aircraft accidents and loss of life and valuable property.

results.title: Flute, clarinet and bassoon
results.brief_description: Introduces three of the woodwind instruments and illustrates the principle by which each produces a musical sound. How a scale is produced by the opening and closing of holes is demonstrated through diagrams and close-ups of each instrument. The instruments are played separately, in pairs and as a trio.

results.title: Flowers by request
results.creator_credit: Susan Wallace, Jules Taylor and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Two women who live quiet, eccentric lives have to come to terms with the possibility of separation when one of them has a stroke. At the point when Martha’s only option is being placed in aged care, Nancy steps in to bolster her friend’s spirits. This is a sensitive portrayal of two older women’s friendship and their struggle to retain this special relationship amid a daughter’s intention to place Martha in care. Cast includes Melissa Jaffer, Betty Lucas and Judy Morris.

results.title: Flowers at work
results.brief_description: Animation and time lapse cinematography show the physiology of flowers, various types of flowers, and their methods of pollination. The part played by insects in the process of cross-fertilisation is illustrated, and the structure and function of the sepals, petals, stamens, pistil, anthers, pollen grains, stle, and ovaries are studied. The film also shows some examples of how cultivation has modified the form of some flowers.
